From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

emocionar (first-person singular indicative present emociono, past participle emocionáu)

  1. (transitive) to move (to arouse the feelings or passions of)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of emocionar
infinitive emocionar
gerund emocionando
past participle m emocionáu, f emocionada, n emocionao, m pl emocionaos, f pl emocionaes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present emociono emociones emociona emocionamos emocionáis emocionen
imperfect emocionaba emocionabes emocionaba emocionábemos, emocionábamos emocionabeis, emocionabais emocionaben
preterite emocioné emocionasti, emocionesti emocionó emocionemos emocionastis, emocionestis emocionaron
pluperfect emocionare, emocionara emocionares, emocionaras emocionare, emocionara emocionáremos, emocionáramos emocionareis, emocionarais emocionaren, emocionaran
future emocionaré emocionarás emocionará emocionaremos emocionaréis emocionarán
conditional emocionaría emocionaríes emocionaría emocionaríemos, emocionaríamos emocionaríeis, emocionaríais emocionaríen
subjunctive present emocione emociones, emocionas emocione emocionemos emocionéis emocionen, emocionan
imperfect emocionare, emocionara emocionares, emocionaras emocionare, emocionara emocionáremos, emocionáramos emocionareis, emocionarais emocionaren, emocionaran
imperative — emociona — — emocionái —

Derived terms

[edit]
  • emocionante

Further reading

[edit]
  • “emocionar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [ə.mu.si.uˈna]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [ə.mo.si.oˈna]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [e.mo.si.oˈnaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

emocionar (first-person singular present emociono, first-person singular preterite emocioní, past participle emocionat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. to move; to touch (emotionally)

[edit]

gerund emocionant

plural emocionats emocionades

negative (no) — no emocionis no emocioni no emocionem no emocioneu no emocionin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • emocionant

Further reading

[edit]
  • “emocionar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “emocionar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “emocionar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “emocionar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Portuguese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.mo.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sɪ.oˈna(h)], (faster pronunciation) /e.mo.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sjoˈna(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.mo.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sɪ.oˈna(h)], (faster pronunciation) /e.mo.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sjoˈna(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /e.mo.si.oˈna(ɾ)/ [e.mo.sɪ.oˈna(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /e.mo.sjoˈna(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /e.mo.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sɪ.oˈna(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /e.mo.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [e.mo.sjoˈna(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /e.mo.si.oˈna(ɻ)/ [e.mo.sɪ.oˈna(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /e.mo.sjoˈna(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.mu.sjuˈnaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.mu.sjuˈnaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.mu.sjuˈna.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: e‧mo‧ci‧o‧nar

Verb

[edit]

emocionar (first-person singular present emociono, first-person singular preterite emocionei, past participle emocionado)

  1. to thrill (to give someone great pleasure)
  2. to move (to arouse the feelings or passions of)
    Synonym: comover

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of emocionar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

Derived terms

[edit]
  • emocionante

Further reading

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /emoθjoˈnaɾ/ [e.mo.θjoˈnaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /emosjoˈnaɾ/ [e.mo.sjoˈnaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: e‧mo‧cio‧nar

Verb

[edit]

emocionar (first-person singular present emociono, first-person singular preterite emocioné, past participle emocionado)

  1. to thrill, to excite
  2. to touch or move (emotionally)
    Synonym: conmover
  3. (reflexive) to get excited
  4. (reflexive) to be thrilled, to be moved, to be touched
    • 2024 June 24, José Carlos Rojo, “«Nos dijeron que sabían que los íbamos a encontrar»”, in El Diario Montañés, page 4:
      Cuentan que Paloma se emocionó al ver sus rescatadores.
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)

[edit]

1Rare; now chiefly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tuteo-form for the present subjunctive.
